{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3228607,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T03:11:58.191Z","cooked":"

Inspired by Mistakes You Made In 2023 Season - #37 by Ryan_Swanson

After several issues at our events this year that we could have caught sooner, I’m interested to know what processes other teams use for systems checks and what you might have done in software to make systems checks easier. Feel free to also share what didn’t work so well and why.

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T03:11:58.191Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":40,"reads":315,"readers_count":314,"score":338.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/mistakes-you-made-in-2023-season/440349/37","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Mistakes You Made In 2023 Season","clicks":19}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/1","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3228614,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T03:29:23.529Z","cooked":"

– raises hand –

So we had a unique team situation last year. Caterpillar was undergoing negotiations with the UAW, and there was a strong chance that a large percentage of our mentors were last-minute going to have to not attend competition. We expected that a lot of “tribal knowledge” of robot debugging was going to be, suddenly and unpredictably, lost.

So we planned ahead, on multiple fronts.

One thing we did was to create a faults class, which made it easy to report detected fault conditions on the robot’s electrical or hardware components. The goal was to ease the pain of debugging - if software knew what was wrong, the software itself would say something.

This fault wrangler did two things:

  1. Made a physical red LED start blinking on the robot when there was 1 or more faults active
  2. Put a string describing the active faults onto the dashboard.

image1048×850 68.8 KB

Pit crew was trained to do a few things.

First, check the “Heartbeat” light. This light was pulsed much like, well, a heartbeat. But critically, it’s brightness was calculated and set from the same robotPeriodic function call that all the other main robot logic went in. This allowed the conclusion that, if the Heartbeat light was blinking, robot code was running.

Second, the “fix me” light would only blink for one or more faults active. If “Fix Me” was blinking, they had to pull up the dashboard, read what the issue was, and fix it.

While the UAW negotiations went well and we didn’t lose mentors, we really liked the concept and hope to replicate it on this coming year’s robot.

Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T03:50:02.263Z","cooked":"

Along the same lines as @gerthworm…

At an offseason in 2021, we had major issues in finals with a disconnected gyro and pressure sensor. We wasted a lot of time figuring out the issues despite the fact that the software could have easily detected it and communicated exactly what was wrong. After that event we created a Shuffleboard plugin (NetworkAlerts) and robot-side class (Alerts) which have been basically unchanged since. It just displays a set of persistent alerts like this:

Alerts902×618 39.7 KB

This is super important for helping us quickly identify issues during our regular system checks, including problems that might not be obvious just moving around each subsystem (like disconnected cameras). Plus, it often means that when there’s an issue in a match the drive team already knows exactly what the problem is before even removing the robot from the field. If we’re lucky, they might have the right data and appropriate overrides to work around it (we try to include some details about the specific consequence of the fault in the messages). I don’t think I can even count how many hours of headaches this little plugin has collectively saved us.

We’ve also also had some alerts that were displayed using the robot’s LEDs so we didn’t need to connect to the dashboard. That’s definitely an idea worth exploring more, particularly since there’s quite a lot that could be encoded using addressable LEDs.

Obviously there’s a lot more to running thorough system checks, but this project was a particularly low-effort high-reward example.

Mechanical-Advantage/NetworkAlerts: A Shuffleboard plugin for displaying persistent alerts.","clicks":7},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/c/f/cfd26adcb7364acdcb706764e49725eb69844e33.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44471,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328M/WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/3","custom_user_title":"6328M/WPILib","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228617,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T03:53:29.276Z","cooked":"

Beautiful, I love the way the messages are phrased.

Around work, we often tell the story of how the exact wording of these things matters.

For example: “Turn signal lamp fault” versus “Turn signal lamp circuit fault”

Software can only diagnose the second one - there’s no way to tell if the faulty condition is inside the lamp itself, or some wiring harness. The first one, while more compact, implies a very specific root cause that will tend to get fixed without further debug.

Annunciate what you can detect. Hedge with your wording if you’re not sure.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T03:53:29.276Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":257,"readers_count":256,"score":51.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228624,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T04:05:19.504Z","cooked":"
jonahb55:

robot-side class (Alerts ) which

Is this basically just string arrays of error, warning, and infos? Is there a way to clear warnings short of restarting robot code?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T04:05:19.504Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":247,"readers_count":246,"score":64.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/5","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228626,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T04:21:05.122Z","cooked":"

Alerts can be activated once and discarded, but they can also be stored and activated or deactivated as necessary. Except for startup alerts, we mostly use the second type. There’s no manual way to clear the faults — we haven’t seen a need for this since they are appropriately prioritized and disappear automatically when the issue is resolved.

new Alert("Startup alert!", AlertType.ERROR).set(true);

private Alert myAlert = new Alert("Subsystem fault!", AlertType.ERROR);
public void periodic() {
    myAlert.set(...fault checking logic);
}
","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T04:21:05.122Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":53.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Jonah Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33946,"username":"Amicus1","name":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44471,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328M/WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/6","custom_user_title":"6328M/WPILib","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228628,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T04:45:24.736Z","cooked":"

Ah, so each possible alert has a persistent object/handle, on which set() is called to determine whether to show the alert. It’s not just a string parameter used when the alert first appears. That makes more sense.

PS. I’m a bit surprised this has no AdvantageKit integration. Was the class too old for that to be an original requirement, or was it just not worth logging?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T04:51:56.429Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":49.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44471,"username":"jonahb55","name":"Jonah Bonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/7","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228630,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T05:07:43.481Z","cooked":"

Yes, this class does predate AdvantageKit. For the most part we’re already logging data that gives us more useful details for debugging (e.g. we don’t really care about an alert saying the camera is disconnected because we can just look at the actual frame counts coming in). In general we find it logical to keep the data feeds for the drivers and programmers separate because they have very different requirements. The alerts are squarely in the “designed for drivers” category.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T05:07:43.481Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":88.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Jonah Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33946,"username":"Amicus1","name":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44471,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328M/WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/8","custom_user_title":"6328M/WPILib","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228631,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T05:12:24.855Z","cooked":"

We’ve been using 6328’s alert widget for a few years, mostly for start up and initialization messages, it’s been great.

We perform a systems check before and after every match of all of the systems. One of the things we have learned is it’s important to actually use a game piece in these tests, just spinning the rollers/wheels isn’t always enough to see if your intake or launcher is working correctly.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T05:12:24.855Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":147.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"AllenGregoryIV","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":10647,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/9","custom_user_title":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228633,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T05:34:31.805Z","cooked":"

Found two loose motors today, one under a nice clean looking 3dp gearbox cover and the other on the back of a planetary that was otherwise rigid and happy.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T05:34:31.805Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":54.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228646,"name":null,"username":"shush","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/aeb1de/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T10:58:51.678Z","cooked":"

This is super cool. I saw on GitHub that NetworkAlerts was made in 2021, will it still work for 2024?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T13:27:57.981Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":31.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44471,"username":"jonahb55","name":"Jonah Bonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/13","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228669,"name":"Ankur Raghavan","username":"Ankur-Raghavan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ankur-raghavan/{size}/207141_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T14:10:36.215Z","cooked":"

We learned very late this season that we need to do regular system checks.

We made a document with everything that needed to get done before a match starts and after the match ended. We put it in sequential order including when the robot should be on or off and enabled. We ended up laminating them and using a dry-erase marker to check each thing off to make sure it happened physically.

We formatted it so time increases as you go down, things on the same level as each other happen at the same time

image571×714 18.6 KB

image546×698 26.2 KB

We also made sure that the everything worked twice. Once right after the match (ideally before even turning the bot off from the match) to find broken things to fix and once again after everyone fixes the robot to make sure everything is good. After that second check, the robot is not allowed to be touched.

We were considering making a test program that would run all the tests automatically, but we didn’t have time, and we figured that it would be best to test it with the driver controls.

As for software, we had issues with our absolute encoders not properly syncing to the relative encoders, so there was a boolean pushed to smart dashboard for each module that was green if they were within a degree of each other. It made it way easier to check if it was set properly.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T14:10:36.215Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":95.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Ankur Raghavan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/8/d/8daf141071f62e98baf7aa5af0ca4a46174a4365.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/b/7/b7429dfb8e4a6d966ee529243f7749df26813094.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50601,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5⁵-4⁴"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/14","custom_user_title":"5⁵-4⁴","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228684,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T14:47:05.660Z","cooked":"

This was 3739’s first year successfully implementing proper systems checks between matches. In previous years there was always something between matches that ate up all our time and had us crunched for time. This year, we were able to field a robust machine that virtually never had any major issues at events, which is what enabled us to routinely run systems checks between matches.

Once the robot returned to the pit, the drive team would give a debrief of any issues they noticed while on the field. A system test was done on the spot with our driver and operator there, then the drive team went off to review the last match with some mentors, while those in the pits thoroughly checked over the mechanical aspects of the robot. Lastly we would perform another system test shortly before going to que for our upcoming match.

Our system check consisted of:

  • Ensuring our auto routine ran through it’s paces as expected (with wheels in the air)
  • Swerve modules operated properly in tele-op (a piece of cardboard gently placed against a wheel while it’s in the air helped visualize the robots movements while on the cart)
  • Move the arm to each of it’s preset positions a handful of times
  • Intake a game piece

We also tried to ensure it was always our drivers performing the system check. There was regularly confusion between what the programmers recalled the controls being, and what the drivers expected the controls to be. Ensuring the drivers performed our system check would allow them to see if anything wasn’t responding the way they expected it should on the field (and hopefully correct that before the next match).

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T14:47:05.660Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/15","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228685,"name":"Ben Ketchum","username":"Splash3015","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/splash3015/{size}/187068_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T14:55:56.803Z","cooked":"

We have a process that we have implemented a few years ago and have been continually refining that has either allowed us to catch and fix, or due to lack of time, at least know about issues in every match we have played the past two seasons.

As soon as the robot comes back from the field, we perform an automated systems check that runs through every system individually, checking motors and sensors. Our pit crew watches this automated check to ensure everything looks like it’s working right and sounds right. Our programmer then looks at the dashboard to make sure all of the motor and sensors were correct on the software side.

Next, we have a checklist that goes through every system, and just about every individual part on the robot to make sure nothing is loose, cracking, broken, no debris in it, etc. Anything we noticed gives us issues regularly at practices gets double checked. Any issues get fixed in this step as well.

Lastly, we perform the same automated check as above again to make sure we did cause any new issues while fixing or checking the rest of the bot. Once this is complete, the robot goes on the cart until the match. We have a (not very strict) policy of once the checks are done, hands off the robot so nothing accidentally happens.

This year we added a TV to our pit that has a custom dashboard with the checklist as well as our automated checks ran through it.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-09-01T14:55:56.803Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":136.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440369,"topic_slug":"systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories","display_username":"Ben Ketchum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41750,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Mech/Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/systems-checks-tips-tricks-stories/440369/16","custom_user_title":"3015 Mech/Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3228692,"name":"Jackson Hochstetler","username":"hochstetjac33","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hochstetjac33/{size}/184799_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-01T15:20:04.991Z","cooked":"

We had a printed checklist for every match, with the match number and name of person performing the checks. This is by no means extensive, but it allowed us to find any problems before the match.
